content:
{{knowledge objective
|Identifiant=OIC-191-05-A
|Item_parent=Fever in an immunocompromised patient
|Item_parent_short=Fever in an immunocompromised patient
|Rank=A
|Intitle=Cite the three main routes of entry for fever in neutropenic patients
|Description=Digestive tract, skin (KT), lung
|Topic=Physiopathology
|Contributors=Amélie Servettaz
|Order=5}}

<big>The main infectious entry points are:</big>

<big>- '''Respiratory'''</big>

<big>- '''Digestive tract''' (mouth to anus)</big>

<big>- '''Skin favored by venous outlets'' (peripheral and central venous catheter)</big>

question.title: Identify the three main routes of entry for fever in neutropenic patients
question.description: What are the main ways a fever can enter the body in immunocompromised patients?

option_a.title: Respiratory and Skin
option_a.description: The main routes of entry for fever in neutropenic patients are the respiratory tract and skin.

option_b.title: Digestive tract, Skin, and Respiratory
option_b.description: The three main routes of entry for fever in neutropenic patients are the digestive tract, skin, and respiratory tract.

option_c.title: Digestive tract and Skin
option_c.description: The two main routes of entry for fever in neutropenic patients are the digestive tract and skin.

option_d.title: Respiratory tract, Skin, and Lymphatic
option_d.description: The three main routes of entry for fever in neutropenic patients are the respiratory tract, skin, and lymphatic system.

correct_option.title: B
correct_option.description: The correct letter indicating the correct option
